subject: CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
body:
CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
OPERATIONS DIRECTORATE,
566 TO 599 VICTORIA ISLAND,
LAGOS NIGERIA.
Congratulation,
This is very urgent and urgent attention is needed.
THE CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA(CBN) writes to inform you That
$15,000,000.00.(fifteen million united states
Dollars) has been approved by the world bank
Organization and Central Bank Of Nigeria as scam
Victim\covid-19 affected compensation fund for those
Which has been affected in the past years. The
$15,000,000.00 will be credited/paid via ATM master
Card to the legal beneficiary, which his\her name has
Been included as scam victim\covid-19 affected
Note: you are requested to confirm your valid
Information to enable the central bank reaches out to
You as the affected person or the family.
Confirm below information;
1, Your names...........
2, Your address..........
3, marital status............
4, phone number..........
5, Your private/secure email address........
6. Your present occupation.............
7. Id card for verification:
Your urgent response is welcomed as we are open to
Receive any question that may disturb you.
Yours sincerely
OFFICIALLY  SIGNED.
Dr Olayemi Cardoso
Executive Governor
Central Bank of Nigeria
Email:drolayemicardoso21@gmail.com

subject: Re:   CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
body:
Hello Dr. Olayemi Cardoso,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must say, this is quite a surprise! I never thought I'd be contacted by the Central Bank of Nigeria.

I'm curious about this situation though. How did my name come up as a scam victim? And how does the World Bank and Central Bank of Nigeria plan to help those affected?

Also, could you please explain more about this ATM Master Card? How will it work exactly?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Kimi

subject: Re: CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
body:
CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
OPERATIONS DIRECTORATE,
566 TO 599 VICTORIA ISLAND,
LAGOS NIGERIA.

       NOTICE FOR YOUR FUND PAYMENT

Dear beneficiary

I received your email
and  there message therein, we want to use this opportunity to
appreciate your  urgent response to such crucial matter. We are
obliged to inform you that we would concur to your email as you have
stated emphatically that you never authorized  anyone to
claim your fund.

My name is Dr Olayemi Cardoso the new Executive Governor Of The
Central  Bank of Nigeria (CBN) and the Executive Chairman of
"E.C.D.R". It may interest you to know that
reports have reached our office by so many correspondences on the
uneasy way which people like you are treated by Various Banks and
Courier Companies/Diplomat across Europe to Africa and Asia / London
Uk. We have decided to put a stop to that.

All Governmental and Non-Governmental prostates, NGOs, Finance
Companies, Banks, Security Companies and Courier companies which have
been in contact with you of late have been instructed to back off from
your transaction and you have been advised NOT to respond to them
anymore since the Central  Bank of Nigeria (CBN) is now directly in
charge of your payment. Your name appeared in our payment schedule
list of beneficiaries that will receive their funds in this first
payment of the year because we only transfer fund twice in a
year according to our banking regulation. We apologize for the delay
of your payment and please stop communicating with any office now and
pay attention to our office payment accordingly.

Now your new Payment, United Nation Approval No; UN5685P,House of
senate Approved No: WH44CV, Reference No.-35460021, Allocation No: 674632,
Password No: 339331, Pin Code No: 55674 and your Certificate of Merit
Payment No: 103, Released Code No: 0763; Immediate (IMF) Telex
confirmation No: -1114433; Secret Code No: XXTN013. Your payment
The inheritance fund is $15,000,000,00Million. Having received these vital
payment numbers, therefore you are qualified now to received and
confirm your payment with the Central  Bank of Nigeria (CBN)
immediately. We assure you that your payment will get to you as long
as you follow my directives and instructions.

We have decided to give you a CODE, THE CODE IS: (4). Please, any time you
receive a mail with the name Dr Olayemi Cardoso, check if there is
CODE (4) if the code is not written, please delete the massage from
your box! You are hereby advised NOT to remit further payment to any
institutions with respect to your transaction as your fund will be
transferred to you directly from our office source,

I hope this is clear. Any action contrary to this instruction
is at your own risk.

Please you are hereby advised to re-frame from all communications with
any party that may claim to be or that is not ordered from this
office.
You will have to reconfirm the following details so that i can set up
a transfer process in your favor.as your previous information in our
archives has been tempered and can not be relied on to avoid
transferring the fund to the wrong person.

Please kindly reconfirm the following information:
1. Name in Full.........
2. Address:........
3. Your Sex........
4. Phone Number........
5. Occupation.........
6. your age & marriage status........
7. valid means of identification......

Wait to hear from you as soon as possible
Best Regards

Sincerely,
Dr Olayemi Cardoso
Executive Governor,
Central Bank of Nigeria

subject: Re: CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
body:
Hello Dr. Olayemi Cardoso,

Thank you for your detailed email and the information provided. It's quite interesting to know that there have been some issues with various banks and courier companies across Europe, Africa, Asia, and London UK. I'm glad to hear that the Central Bank of Nigeria is now directly in charge of my payment.

I appreciate the CODE you've given me for future correspondence. That's a smart way to ensure security and authenticity.

You mentioned about reconfirming some details for setting up the transfer process. However, I am not comfortable sharing personal information over email due to privacy concerns. Is there any other secure method we can use?

Also, could you please elaborate more on how this payment schedule works? And why was my name included in this list? I'm curious to understand more about this process.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Kimi

subject: Re: CENTRAL BANK OF NIGERIA,
body:
Hello Dr. Olayemi Cardoso,

Thank you for your detailed email and the information provided. It's quite interesting to know about the new changes in the Central Bank of Nigeria.

I'm curious, how did my name appear on your payment schedule list? I don't recall having any business or transactions with your bank before. 

Also, could you please explain more about this CODE you mentioned? How does it work and why is it important?

I appreciate your efforts to ensure a smooth transaction process. However, I would like to understand more about this whole process before proceeding further.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Kimi
